1.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to reign; inceptively, to ascend the throne; causatively, to induct into royalty; hence (by implication) to take counsel
to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

2.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

3.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

4.brief: strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
evenness, i.e. (figuratively) prosperity or concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) rectitude (only in plural with singular sense; often adverbially)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

6.brief: literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
Shemuel, the name of three Israelites
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

near, with or among; often in general, to

properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

7.brief: a column (as standing); also a stand, i.e. platform
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to grudge, i.e. avenge or punish

an exploit (of God), or a performance (of man, often in a bad sense); by implication, an opportunity
